Uses of Class
com.sirqul.sdk.responses.PurchaseItemResponse

  • Packages that use PurchaseItemResponse 
    Package Description
    com.sirqul.sdk.api.application
    Contains API classes that fall under the Application category.
    com.sirqul.sdk.responses
    Contains response classes of which json responses are mapped to using Gson.

    • Uses of PurchaseItemResponse in com.sirqul.sdk.api.application

      Methods in com.sirqul.sdk.api.application that return types with arguments of type PurchaseItemResponse 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> PurchaseItemApiBase.createPurchaseItem(Long accountId, String appKey, String name, String description, Integer tickets, Float price, Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType, String purchaseCode, String secretKey, Integer purchaseLimit, Enums.ServiceAction serviceAction, Long coverAssetId, Long promoAssetId, Boolean giftable, Boolean assetable)
      Creates a purchase item for in app purchases.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/create
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> PurchaseItemApiBase.getPurchaseItem(Long accountId, Long purchaseItemId)
      Get detailed information about a purchase item.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/get
      SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> PurchaseItemApiBase.searchPurchaseItems(Long accountId, String appKey, Boolean filterByBillable, List<Enums.PurchaseType> purchaseTypes, List<Enums.ServiceAction> serviceActions, String keyword, Enums.PurchaseItemApiMap sortField, Boolean descending, Integer start, Integer limit, Boolean activeOnly)
      Search for purchasable items from the system.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/search
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> PurchaseItemApiBase.updatePurchaseItem(Long accountId, Long purchaseItemId, String name, String description, Integer tickets, Float price, Enums.PurchaseType purchaseType, String purchaseCode, String secretKey, Integer purchaseLimit, Enums.ServiceAction serviceAction, Long coverAssetId, Long promoAssetId, Boolean giftable, Boolean assetable, Boolean active)
      Updates a purchase item for in app purchases.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/update
      Method parameters in com.sirqul.sdk.api.application with type arguments of type PurchaseItemResponse 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void PurchaseItemApi.createPurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
      Creates a purchase item for in app purchases.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/create

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      The application key that the purchase can be used in SirqulKeys.name
      The name of the purchase item SirqulKeys.description
      The description of the purchase item SirqulKeys.tickets
      How much the purchase item is worth in tickets SirqulKeys.price
      How much the purchase item will cost in real money SirqulKeys.purchaseType
      The purchase provider SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch GOOGLE - the Google Play store AMAZON - the Amazon Android store MAC - the iTunes store for OSX WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes) SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
      The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases SirqulKeys.secretKey
      A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation SirqulKeys.purchaseLimit
      How many times a user acquire the same purchase item SirqulKeys.serviceAction
      Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
      The cover image of the purchase item SirqulKeys.promoAssetId
      An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data SirqulKeys.giftable
      Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users SirqulKeys.assetable
      Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
      void PurchaseItemApi.getPurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
      Get detailed information about a purchase item.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/get

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.purchaseItemId
      The purchase item id
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
      void PurchaseItemApi.searchPurchaseItems(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<SearchResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
      Search for purchasable items from the system.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/search

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.appKey of type String
      The application key to filter results by application SirqulKeys.filterByBillable
      Determines whether to filter results by the user's billable entity SirqulKeys.purchaseTypes
      the purchase types SirqulKeys.serviceActions
      the service actions SirqulKeys.keyword
      The keyword used to search SirqulKeys.sortField
      The column to sort the search on.
      void PurchaseItemApi.updatePurchaseItem(Map<String,Object> params, ISirqulCallback<WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse>> callback)
      Updates a purchase item for in app purchases.

      Target API Endpoint: /purchase/update

      Available parameters for this api SirqulKeys.accountId of type Long
      The account id of the user (deviceId or accountId required) SirqulKeys.purchaseItemId
      The purchase item id SirqulKeys.name
      The name of the purchase item SirqulKeys.description
      The description of the purchase item SirqulKeys.tickets
      How much the purchase item is worth in tickets SirqulKeys.price
      How much the purchase item will cost in real money SirqulKeys.purchaseType
      The purchase provider SIRQUL - the Sirqul store to make purchases using tickets IOS - the iTunes store for iPhone, iPod, iPod Touch GOOGLE - the Google Play store AMAZON - the Amazon Android store MAC - the iTunes store for OSX WP8 - the Windows Phone 8 store FREE - used for purchase items that are free (can be used for development/testing purposes) SirqulKeys.purchaseCode
      The unique identifier used by purchase providers to identify in-app-purchases SirqulKeys.secretKey
      A secret key from purchase providers that would be used for validation SirqulKeys.purchaseLimit
      How many times a user acquire the same purchase item SirqulKeys.serviceAction
      Determines whether the purchase item will enable certain features DAY_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a day of membership WEEK_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a week of membership MONTH_PREMIUM - subscribes a user for a month of membership ADD_TICKET - allows a user to add more tickets to their account ADD_GIFT - allows a user to send/recieve the purchase item as a gift SirqulKeys.coverAssetId
      The cover image of the purchase item SirqulKeys.promoAssetId
      An application specific asset that can be used to store/provide additional data SirqulKeys.giftable
      Determines whether the purchase item can be gifted to other users SirqulKeys.assetable
      Determines whether users can attach their own media/asset to the purchase item SirqulKeys.active
      Sets whether the purchase item is active or inactive (hidden from consumers)
      SirqulResponse subclass type:
      WrappedResponse<PurchaseItemResponse> on a valid response, SirqulResponse on an invalid response
